ComplementDNASeq

ComplementDNASeq provides a small set of utilities for working with DNA sequences, starting with a robust implementation of a reverse-complement helper. The package normalises input, validates characters, and returns the expected Watson–Crick pairing for common workflows.

Installation

You can install the development version of ComplementDNASeq from GitHub with:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("cedrichk/ComplementDNASeq")

Alternatively, clone the repository locally and run devtools::load_all() while developing.

Example

The exported reverse_complement() function returns the reverse complement of a DNA sequence while enforcing A/C/G/T input.

library(ComplementDNASeq)

reverse_complement("GATTACA")
#> [1] "TGTAATC"
#> [1] "TGTAATC"

Lowercase input is accepted and uppercased automatically.

reverse_complement("acgt")
#> [1] "ACGT"
#> [1] "ACGT"

Testing

ComplementDNASeq uses the testthat framework. You can execute the test suite with:

devtools::test()

Make sure the development dependencies (testthat, waldo, and a recent pkgload) are installed before running the tests.
